tool.name: Unique.seqs
tool.command:
## create symlinks to input datasets ln -s "$names" names.dat && ln -s "$count" count.dat && ln -s "$fasta" fasta.dat &&
echo 'unique.seqs( #if $names: name=names.dat, #end if #if $count: count=count.dat, #end if fasta=fasta.dat )' | sed 's/ //g' ## mothur trips over whitespace | mothur

param.name: names
param.label: names - Sequences Names
param.help: you may supply either a names file or a count table, but not both

param.name: count
param.label: count - Count Table
param.help: you may supply either a names file or a count table, but not both

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The unique.seqs_ command returns only the unique sequences found in a fasta-formatted sequence file and a name_ file that indicates those sequences that are identical to the reference sequence.
.. _name: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Name_file .. _unique.seqs: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Unique.seqs
